p: Estragole, a volatile terpenoid, is the primary constituent of EO of tarragon (comprising 60â€“75%). It has several pharmacological and biological activities, including antioxidant, anxiolytic, and antimicrobial activities [ 82]. The mechanism of action of estragole on neuronal excitability was recently investigated. The intact and dissociated dorsal root ganglion neurons of rats were used to record action potential and Na + currents with intracellular and patch-clamp techniques, respectively. It was found that estragole blocked neuronal excitability by direct inhibition of Na + channel conductance activation.
